website_summaries.verdict: An affordable option that both works well and does not harm the environment.
pros: Has an eco-friendly formula that comes in 16- or 20-ounce sizes
Both inflates and repairs tires for on and off-road vehicles
Good instructions, and safe for vehicles with tire sensors
cons: Some customers have had problems with cans only pushing out 1/3 to 1/2 of their contents before stopping
The clear cap on it can be hard to remove

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Got a flat tire. Pulled this thing out, screw it onto the valve, pushed ...... nothing. In about 30 seconds I finally saw some foam coming into the transparent tube - but very, very slowly. Moving like a snail. After 2 minutes the tube broke at its base and started spewing foam all over my hand. Will never buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Angelo

customer_reviews.title: Total Rip-off!  Worthless product both cans.
customer_reviews.text: 100% completely worthless! Don’t waste your $, this is the second can I’ve tried , and both times the everything leaked out of the tube at the nozzle. I’m very Dosapointed! Will never again purchase these, I did exactly as the instructions on the can said. Get more bang for your buck if you use your bills to blow your nose. Pay more & get something that will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: BenjaminM

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two cans to use on my yard tractor. First of all the tops are very difficult to get off. The first can worked fine but the second can explodes out the top when I tried to use it. The mess was considerable. I tried the first can on it as there was a little bit left and what was there went in. Not good. By the way I have used this stuff for years but no more.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Not great but got the job done for one tire
customer_reviews.text: It did its job for one tire, after that the nozzle seemed to have broken off or clogged. It no longer sprays the foam into the tire but it leaks outward. Afterwards the foam kept the tire from leaking for a few days which is what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: J.oli

customer_reviews.title: Fix your flat, no new tire
customer_reviews.text: So your suppose to use this to get your car yo the gas station so they can fix your tire. I used it to fix a small leak and when I brought it to the tire shop they couldn’t find the leak so I saved myself the cost of a new tire. However it did mess with the tire senser and I had to reset the tire pressure settings a few times before this problem subsided.
customer_reviews.author: Vinny C

customer_reviews.title: Life saver!
customer_reviews.text: It saved me just a few days after I order it. The only downside is that my mechanic told me to always bring the car asap to remove the product since it may damage the sensor regardles of what the descriprion om the spay show. It may also damage the tire and the wheel.
customer_reviews.author: PL

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I've used fix-a-flat many times for wheelbarrow and hand truck tires that constantly leaked. But like others have said this is crap. Nothing went in the tire and it basically blew up everywhere. The hose would full and pressurize, then everything would blow back out by the nozzle. The only time anything went in the tire, was when it ran out of pressure, then it would slowly trickle into the tire but didnt pressurize it.
customer_reviews.author: Jay. S.

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctioned in use. Don’t waste your money...
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to have on hand, and when I needed it, it didn’t work/foam came out of the top where the tubing connects to the canister. So I still have a flat on my riding mower. I recommend you find a different brand or only buy it when you need it, so if it malfunctions, you can still return it, as it was past the return window...
customer_reviews.author: maudedog

customer_reviews.title: Sadly had a chance to use this.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as the last resort backup option if I got a flat. Well...got a flat and this was the last chance option. Worked well enough to get me to a shop to get the tire patched without ruining the rim of the wheel. That's what it is for and that's what it did. 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Dave D

customer_reviews.title: Undetectable very slow leak repaired.
customer_reviews.text: Every 1-2 months I would get a low-pressure alert from the same tire. 2 trips to the tire shop, unable to find a leak. One can of this Fiz A Flat when the tire pressure was low the problem is resolved, so far.
customer_reviews.author: Rick from South Florida

customer_reviews.title: This stuff fixed flats on two different tires.  They stayed fixed.
customer_reviews.text: Over the last couple months, I've had a big construction project going on at my house. Contractors seem to like to drop screws all over the driveway, resulting in two flats. I used this product on both and my tires have stayed fixed for about 3 months now. I can think of nothing bad to say about this product. Five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Rylan Grant

customer_reviews.title: Especially useful if you don't have a spare
customer_reviews.text: Most cars I've owned have had a spare. Even if only a temporary mini tire spare, it's still something. My current car annoyingly didn't come w/ one, nor does it even really have room for one. So having fix a flat is pretty much the only option aside from always waiting for a tow/roadside assistance.
customer_reviews.author: cannabible customer

customer_reviews.title: Not user friendly
customer_reviews.text: The plastic tube leaks formula from both ends. The tube is poorly attached to the can and the tube remains coiled while using making it difficult to attach to the air valve. People would pay more for a better product. Needs more psi.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hyland

customer_reviews.title: If you don't use it, you will lose it.
customer_reviews.text: Got a chance to use this product 6 months after I purchased it. I don't know if it's sat around too long or what. It barely pumped up the tire. I just remember the old stuff from way back it pump it up fast and full.
customer_reviews.author: geohar

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK
customer_reviews.text: Defective productive now out of warranty ... or just doesn’t work, at all. White stuff barely moves through tube connected or not. Awful experience will never buy again. DOES NOT WORK
customer_reviews.author: techgeek

customer_reviews.title: Very Old Stock
customer_reviews.text: The two I ordered were both out of propellant. I tried to use them the day I got them on a Ford Ranger tire, and neither would inflate the tire at all. Fortunately I also have an air pump.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Probably a terrible long term solution
customer_reviews.text: My wheelbarrow kept going flat and the wheel is tubeless and would have been a pain to fix. I put most of a can in the valve and wheeled it around for a couple minutes and it's held air perfectly and nothing has escaped. Probably a terrible long term solution, but it's a junky wheelbarrow anyway! I bought a new can to leave in the car.
customer_reviews.author: Andy G

customer_reviews.title: Must have for the trunk.
customer_reviews.text: Must have for the trunk. If you don't have a spare tire it can save so much time it gives you about 30 miles to get to a place to fix a flat or change it.
customer_reviews.author: Filip

customer_reviews.title: Good in a pinch...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for emergencies on the road. I haven’t used mine yet, but I have seen a family member use theirs. It seems to work long enough to get to a repair shop, but not much longer.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn

customer_reviews.title: Does not work like advertised.
customer_reviews.text: You cannot use this can on but one tire. I tried filling some lawn mower tires and by the time I took the can off the rear tire it had already solidified in the tube and I could not use on the front tire. Needless to say, I wasted about 3/4 of the can. Would not recommend this product to anyone. If you need to repair a tire. Purchase a plug kit.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Completely worthless
customer_reviews.text: I had the foresight, for once in my life, to buy this preventative product. Had a flat. Read the instructions, followed them, hooked it up and activated. Nothing. No charge. Stranded on the freeway. Worse than worthless.
customer_reviews.author: tomerson

customer_reviews.title: Works good.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well tier is still holding up after 300 miles. One thing I don't like is that 25% of the can doesn't empty.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: This stuff always comes through and stops slow leaks. I keep a can ready at all times.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: Stuff was horrible . Did not even come out of the can. Tried everything , shook can for 5 minutes to no avail. Will never purchase this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does what is says it will. No more, no less.
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done, I've used it to help with slow leaks. 1-5psi every week in the fall car sits alot. 2 cans for 4,, 14 inch tires 185/60. I've left it in rims for years, might just be my luck.
customer_reviews.author: Ant

customer_reviews.title: Great value for an easy fix
customer_reviews.text: After fooling around with a leaky tire for months, I finally decided to use this and I'm so glad I did! I haven't had any more trouble with the tire, plus I got this as an add-on item so I'm happy with the price I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Karen,Atlanta

customer_reviews.title: Works on ATV tires great
customer_reviews.text: This indeed fixed our flat on our four wheeler. It was slowly leaking air. This pumped it up and stopped the leak. Four months later and still no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Bear Bethay

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver. Every car should have a can in the trunk.
customer_reviews.text: It really works. I keep one in my car and one in my wife’s car at all times. This will get you off the side of the road and to a service station. Super easy to use. Make sure you tell the tire repair people that you used it as it affects the repair.
customer_reviews.author: jonloft

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I mean it's fix-a-flat. It works great, and will get you out a bind. Just make sure to roll the car forward and backward to move it around in the tire to find the nail and seal it.
customer_reviews.author: V M

customer_reviews.title: worked great!
customer_reviews.text: My husband used this on one of our driving lawn mower tires.... worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: Have used this kind of product in the past. Can't remember for sure if it was this brand. Never had a problem. This time the tube that carries the foam began to separate from the can and started spraying foam over everything in the area. Big mess. Both cans had the same problem. Should have quit after the first mess.
customer_reviews.author: S. Gill

customer_reviews.title: Great past experiences!
customer_reviews.text: These things have worked great for me in the past when I hit something sharp on the road and used this to patch the inner wheel to let me drive without losing more tire pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for wheelbarrow tire
customer_reviews.text: Instead of buying new tire I just use this works great, 3 seconds done....
customer_reviews.author: Susan J. Miles

customer_reviews.title: It was like they did not have enough pressure inside them
customer_reviews.text: This did not work. I had 2 cans of this, and neither of them would fill the tire. It was like they did not have enough pressure inside them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Helper
customer_reviews.text: I have a slow leak in one of my tires . I used half can , add air and my tire pressure light did not come on for weeks It was well worth it
customer_reviews.author: Winner 87

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It’s fix a flat. Every vehicle we have has a can. It sure beats waiting for a tow truck at 11pm in a sketchy part of town :) not a position I want my family in. This stuff works on almost all tires.
customer_reviews.author: justin

customer_reviews.title: No,pressure in can
customer_reviews.text: Can had contents but no air pressure to deliver product into a tire. Worthless
customer_reviews.author: James Black

customer_reviews.title: 2nd can that the hose failed on me
customer_reviews.text: This is the second can that failed on me. I figured the first was a fluke and let it go. The second time the hose actually popped and sprayed the sealant everywhere. This was enough to warrant a return. Only to realize this item is not available to return because it is flammable. I will buy these from a physical store going forward
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Good o reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Used for my wheelbarrow but eventually the tire leaks air so I don't use the whole can in one shot.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT WILLIAMS

customer_reviews.title: Haven't had to use this one yet
customer_reviews.text: They can be a life saver if you have a flat on the road, especially if it's your girlfriend or wife .
customer_reviews.author: BUBBA GUMP

customer_reviews.title: Flats suck
customer_reviews.text: Flats suck. This is the cure. I have spares in each car and one put back for the lawn mower, garden cart, and two wheel dolly.
customer_reviews.author: Southern VetTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Works good, tire has been holding air for a few weeks now
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Total garbage
customer_reviews.text: Total waste of time and money I would not recommend this to anyone this product does not work
customer_reviews.author: Grampa1999

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: I always have 1 of these in my car for emergencies. Not only does it seal the leak, it inflates your tire!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Worked OK as one time use
customer_reviews.text: Worked OK as one time use but cannot be re-used as it plugged. Guess for emergency only.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Seda

customer_reviews.title: Fix-a-flat for bigger tires at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Fix-a-flat for bigger tires at a good price. Always handy to carry in a vehicle in case of an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Comps

customer_reviews.title: Fix-A-Flat S60430 Tire Inflato
customer_reviews.text: contents leaked out of the cap of the cylinder had to contact customer service for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Rau

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: Anyone that has lots of various tires to take care off should always have a can of this stuff handy. Work's like a dream!
customer_reviews.author: Lew Orban

customer_reviews.title: tried and true.
customer_reviews.text: This large can does have the hose. Found that a slow leak that comes and goes was do to ,the rim. Fix a flat does the job. It also worked on my riding mower tire.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene W Ahlfors

customer_reviews.title: low presure in can
customer_reviews.text: seemed to be old stock not much pressure wont buy again
customer_reviews.author: ezreader

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: I used it on an inflatable tire on a utility wagon. It stopped the leak and negated buying a new wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Foxfire

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Used it yesterday to inflate my wheelbarrow tire that had a huge hole around the valve.
customer_reviews.author: Don Horner

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great in an emergency but leaks foam at canister button this is the 3rd one it happened with
customer_reviews.author: Dana Crivella

customer_reviews.title: I wheely hope this works
customer_reviews.text: Not been used because the tires haven't got a nail in them yet but it looks like good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: humblepie

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: It works for small hole. My mechanic was not able to find the nail, I fill the air it last only three days , since I used this I never went to fill the air any more , so it’s works
customer_reviews.author: Pk

customer_reviews.title: I keep this in the car just in case.
customer_reviews.text: I keep this in the car just in case. It has always worked in the past and see no reason it won't work in the future
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Price was ok. Did not work as needed
customer_reviews.text: Did not work the best for me unfortunately. I had to buy a new tire instead.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: I fixed my flat with it and I drove over 5 thousand miles already with it. It's still good.
customer_reviews.author: Zoya

customer_reviews.title: Did the job
customer_reviews.text: My tire light will turn on ~ one month. This product fix the issue so far.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: sealed a small leak
customer_reviews.text: Had an issue with a seal on the rim. This fixed the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk B.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: only 1/4 can work and it stop do not buy also cap was broke off when I got it
customer_reviews.author: Thomas D. Nowland

customer_reviews.title: So far questionably.
customer_reviews.text: Does not inflate tire and fluid does not drain out of can, only a little came out.
customer_reviews.author: J.  R. P.

customer_reviews.title: Glad I have it
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t had to use it. It makes me feel secure knowing it’s there.
customer_reviews.author: Julianna Mascio

customer_reviews.title: Product did not work.
customer_reviews.text: The product failed. 2 of the cans simply didn’t work. I was past the return date so I’m basically screwed. Will not buy from this vendor again.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Hit & Miss
customer_reviews.text: Last time I used it the area where the nail was did not seal!
customer_reviews.author: jpal5207

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Plan B for my trailer which doesn’t have a spare.
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This saved my ass! Keeping more in my car for emergencies.
customer_reviews.author: Annette

customer_reviews.title: I've used this product before and had no problems, ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product before and had no problems, but this time I think the product was frozen in transit and clogged the tire valve, and lost all its pressure.
customer_reviews.author: CCW

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Used on my leaking tire and it did fix it.
customer_reviews.author: J.L.

customer_reviews.title: I followed the directions & it did not work
customer_reviews.text: I followed the directions and it did not work. The product came oozing out of the hole in the tire (about the size of a screw). I thought it was working once I saw the ooze, but it did not keep the tire air inside.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fix a flat
customer_reviews.text: Worked well when we had a flat on our side by side OHV in back country.
customer_reviews.author: Aleck Shilaos

customer_reviews.title: Want my money back
customer_reviews.text: Worst product I ever used, unable to fill the tires and when button was released all the foam poured out were those goes in can. Junk
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compressed air leaked out and was unusable
customer_reviews.text: I followed the directions exactly and quickly discovered all the compressed air had leaked out and it was completely worthless. Waste of money and Amazon will not allow a return.
customer_reviews.author: Jax

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: I had a nail puncture. This got me to the tire place to get back on the road.
customer_reviews.author: carmi n.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Fix a Flat Can
customer_reviews.text: When fix a flat installed into tire, started leaking at can and at valve stem; removed from tire fix a flat fluid came out from can and spurted everywhere making a big mess.
customer_reviews.author: Keri Gray

customer_reviews.title: Fix-A-Flat shooting blanks!
customer_reviews.text: Very DISAPPOINTED! I have used earlier versions with good results. This new improved version, quite frankly, stinks. On the first tire, inflator stopped flowing after approx 1/3 empty------second tire----inflator stopped after approx 1/2 empty! In both cases instructions were followed carefully. Shook cans vigorously for one to two minutes so that is not a factor. The remaining two cans I plan using on my lawn tractor and snow thrower as they have smaller capacity.
customer_reviews.author: John N. Schoen

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: None of these cans function properly - we have used this brand of product before - these were defective.
customer_reviews.author: Martin L Schulman

customer_reviews.title: Great for on road and off-road vehicles
customer_reviews.text: I swear by this stuff. I carry it my cars and my off-road buggy. My car had a very slow leak in one of the tires. So I put about half of a can in and then drove the car a few miles. I could not find where the leak was coming from, but the fix a flat sealed it. I’ve also used it in my off-road buggy. The pressure in that vehicle’s tires are much lower than a regular car, so I can will fix multiple flats/leaks In that situation
customer_reviews.author: Steve-o

customer_reviews.title: This leaked more out where the fill tube attaches to the can than went into the tire
customer_reviews.text: This leaked more out where the fill tube attaches to the can than went into the tire. I tried to return it and was told because of what it is that it couldn't be returned.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Basically useless didn't seal a slow small leak. Contents of can also wouldn't empty out.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Lew

customer_reviews.title: The cover was very difficult to remove. Once I ...
customer_reviews.text: The cover was very difficult to remove. Once I was able to start using it, hardly any foam came out of the can. I paid a high premium for this product (compared to others on sale) and feel cheated.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst and dangerous product, which should never be sold! I tried one of my tire when it got punctured and it seemed to be working fine, but few days later that tire becomes unevenly swallowed. Luckly, I could find the gas station to change with my spare tire. I thought this is great product and purchased 5 cans. I tried to return these but they do not accept return! This is the real worst product and shoul not be sold to people for the sake of safty! I threw away my relative new tire which I paid $200 because of this bad product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 cans. They could not inflate my SUV tire, my garden cart tire and my riding lawn mower tire. Totally worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Boundary

customer_reviews.title: Arrived fine, but didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Arrived fine, but didn't work. Didn't inflate the tire and only a small amount of stuff was pushed out. Ended up getting refund and getting tire fixed elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Buckeye

customer_reviews.title: Great value. Solid stuff for the wheels.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value. Cheaper than what you can find in stores and love it was a multi pack. I’ll definitely order in the future
customer_reviews.author: Npalumbo89

customer_reviews.title: I used this product for many years and I am sure I will love this product
customer_reviews.text: I have not a chance to use it but, I used this product for many years and I am sure I will love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well as I fixed 3 tires that had slow leaks and I still have some left.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Yarrick

customer_reviews.title: Fixes flats as the name suggests.
customer_reviews.text: Always keep 2 cans in the car. Sometimes changing out a flat can be dangerous or it’s just not possible due to location or whatever. This can get you going quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Fonsie

customer_reviews.title: Flat tire. Quick fix
customer_reviews.text: Fix a flat. Easy. To use. Keep handy in your car. Ps. Keep inside car in winter. Can will freeze. Jim
customer_reviews.author: jim

product_meta.title: Fix-A-Flat Tire Sealant and Car/SUV Tire Inflator 20oz
product_meta.description: Fix-A-Flat Aerosol Tire Inflators seal punctures and inflate the tire in seconds without the need for a jack, spare tire, or any tools, allowing you to get off the road and to a service station where an approved repair can be made. This non-flammable formula is easy and safe to use, and cleans up easily with water. Fix-A-Flat Aerosol Tire Inflators are the cheapest and quickest way to repair a flat tire in an emergency. Fix-A-Flat Aerosol Tire Inflators are designed to seal small tire punctures and provide enough inflation to lift the rim off the ground.
feature_bullets: Quick and Safe: Easily use on all highway large vehicle tires for emergency flat tire repair and tire inflation, then professionally repair within 3 days
Seals and Inflates: Our aerosol tire sealant seals large tread area punctures, then inflates your tire in seconds with the push of a button
Be Prepared: Seals up to 1/4 inch punctures and there is no need for a jack, tools, or a spare tire; also TPMS safe
Protected: Store our non-flammable, non-toxic, non-corrosive and eco friendly formula in the spare tire well or in the trunk of your car
Trusted: In the car tire inflator business for 50 years

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars287 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
